title: Scatterplot vs. Residual Plot
question_text:
Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.

Consider the scatterplot to the left and its accompanying residual plot to the right.
Which of the following statements is TRUE?

choices.text: The residual plot shows a moderate correlation.
The scatterplot shows a weak linear correlation.
The residual plot shows that a linear model might not be best for this situation since the absolute value of the residuals is so large.
The residual plot shows that a linear model might not be best for this situation since the residual plot shows a pattern.
Both plots show a history of underpredicting then overpredicting and then underpredicting once again.

solution:
Residual plots should show no pattern, and this residual plot clearly does.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect; residual plots will have zero correlation even if there is some pattern.

Choice 'B' is incorrect; while the data does not appear exactly linear since the data still remains close to the LSRL, there will be a strong correlation. However, a transformed model will have an even stronger correlation.

Choice 'C' is incorrect; while the residual plot does show a linear model might not be best, it is not because the residuals are overly large. In fact, it appears that the residuals have fairly low values.

Choice 'E' is incorrect; a residual of
0
is what is predicted; therefore, this model overpredicts, then underpredicts, and then overpredicts once again.
